intro: Biota gracilifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaf biota, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understoreys. Biota gracilifolia is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid climates.
